sentences.sContent: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.sCn: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.sContent: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.sCn: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.sContent: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.sCn: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。

sentences.sContent: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.sCn: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.sContent: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.sCn: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.sContent: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.sCn: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

remMethod.val: bound(界限) ＋ ary(表场所) → 界限 → 边界

words.tran: 有义务的；受约束的；装有封面的

trans.tranOther: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone
